roleset.name: mix ingredients gently
roleset.note: FOLD-V NOTES: Frames file for 'fold' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entries 26.5, 40.3.2, 26.1, 45.2 (from fold.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: not the context I expected
example.text: To gain more leverage, [abortion-rights advocates]-1 may seek *trace*-1 to fold the bill into an omnibus continuing resolution next month.

roleset.name: fold hands
roleset.note: FOLD-V NOTES: Frames file for 'fold' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entries 26.5, 40.3.2, 26.1, 45.2 (from fold.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: like a good boy
example.text: John folded his hands neatly in Mary's lap.

roleset.name: origami
roleset.note: FOLD-V NOTES: Frames file for 'fold' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entries 26.5, 40.3.2, 26.1, 45.2 (from fold.03-v predicate notes)

example.name: transitive with material
example.text: A dozen white office workers fold newsletters and stuff them into envelopes.

example.name: construction as PP
example.text: John folded the newspaper into a sailboat for Mary.

example.name: material as PP
example.text: John folded a sailboat out of newspaper.

roleset.name: stop playing cards
roleset.note: FOLD-V NOTES: Frames file for 'fold' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entries 26.5, 40.3.2, 26.1, 45.2 (from fold.04-v predicate notes)

example.name: not quite cards
example.text: Given that choice, associates of Mr. Hahn and industry observers say the former university president -- who has developed a reputation for not overpaying for anything -- would fold.
example.arg: the former university president -- who has developed a reputation for not overpaying for anything --

roleset.name: (terminate) a failing business
roleset.note: FOLD-V NOTES: Frames file for 'fold' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entries 26.5, 40.3.2, 26.1, 45.2 (from fold.06-v predicate notes)

example.name: business as subject
example.text: The Herald joins the Baltimore News-American, which *trace* folded, and the Boston Herald-American, which was sold, as cornerstones of the old Hearst newspaper empire abandoned by the company in the 1980s.

example.name: owner as subject
example.text: Within the same nine months, News Corp. closed down In Fashion, a once-promising young woman's fashion magazine, Drake Publications Inc. has folded the long-troubled Venture magazine, and Lang Communications has announced Ms. magazine, after 17 years, will no longer carry advertising as of January.

roleset.name: origami
roleset.note: FOLD_UP-V NOTES: Except for the particle, should be identical to fold.03. (from fold.05-v)

example.name: a token example
example.text: A dozen white office workers fold up newsletters and stuff them into envelopes.
